text: we may not often consider them but one
of the most important evolutionary
aspects of the human body is our feet
and like our backs teeth and eyes modern
life is changing them for example in the
last four decades our feet have grown by
two sizes why half a million years ago
our feet made it both possible for us to
walk incredibly long distances but also
to run and hunt the arches and our feet
are both sturdy and elastic and concern
15% of our body weights into propulsive
energy with every step but sometime
around 40,000 years ago the first shoes
were invented we know this because the
muscle attachments and fossil remains
suddenly start to become a little
smaller from their very beginning
shooters have been making our feets
weaker today this weakness is worsened
by the fact that we moved so much less
than they used to in richer nations more
than 80 percent of work is now done in a
chair and at the end of the day we put
our feet up for some gaming to watch TV
you browse the web shoes and lack of use
maker arch muscles weaker our feet
flattened and so appear to have grown
up to 30% of people in wealthier
countries now have flat feet flat feet
can change our posture causing problems
in the ankle knee hip back or neck and
can discourage us from exercising and
diminish our quality of life certain
exercises like doming and heel lifts can
help restore strength to our feets
making it easier for us to get back some
of the movement that modern life for
centuries has been taking from us
[Music]
